hanzi-su-wiki:
調

Значения

Выяснять, расследовать; приводить в порядок, устраивать; тон, тональность, интонация, акцент

Мнемоника

  • Говорить 言 кругами 周, т.е. об одном и том же, пытаясь добиться исчерпывающего ответа.

  • "Они сказали, что 言 будут приводить в порядок всё вокруг 周."

Варианты

调

jp_example_words:
協調(きょうちょう): co-operation, conciliation, harmony, firm (market) tone
好調(こうちょう): favourable, promising, satisfactory, in good shape
下調べ(したしらべ): preliminary investigation, preparation
失調(しっちょう): lack of harmony
調べ(しらべ): preparation, investigation, inspection
単調(たんちょう): monotony, monotone, dullness
調印(ちょういん): signature, sign, sealing
調停(ちょうてい): arbitration, conciliation, mediation
調理(ちょうり): cooking
調和(ちょうわ): harmony
同調(どうちょう): sympathy, agree with, alignment, tuning
取り調べる(とりしらべる): to investigate, to examine
不調(ふちょう): bad condition, not to work out (ie a deal), disagreement, break-off, disorder, slump, out of form
強調(きょうちょう): emphasis, stress, stressed point
順調(じゅんちょう): favourable, doing well, O.K., all right
調査(ちょうさ): investigation, examination, inquiry, survey
調子(ちょうし): tune, tone, key, pitch, time, rhythm, vein, mood, way, manner, style, knack, condition, state of health, strain, impetus, spur of the moment, trend
調整(ちょうせい): regulation, adjustment, tuning
調節(ちょうせつ): regulation, adjustment, control
調味料(ちょうみりょう): condiment, seasoning
調べる(しらべる): investigate
jp_readingExamples: 調べる (しら.べる), 調う (ととの.う), 調える (ととの.える)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You say something about the circumference of this area. You've looked around this whole area, making a big circle around it, because you are trying to investigate something that happened here. You also say this thing in a really quiet tone of voice, because you don't want the person or thing you're investigating to know you're on to them.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Because the radical circumference is in play, you can think of the crime scene you're investigating as a statue of a giant globe, and you're doing a circumference around it. Then, in the reading, we'll think about what you'll say.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: "I came here to investigate this place, and I did indeed find out who the criminal is... it's none other than Mrs. Chou (ちょう)!"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: From what you know about evil Mrs. Chou, you probably could have guessed it was her. The "Circumference Investigation" is now over, though you do still have to catch the perp, Mrs. Chou.

humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " speak " and " week ", the original meaning is harmony and suitability. "Shuowen": "Harmony. Congyan, Zhou Sheng." "Poetry·Xiaoya·Chegong": "Decision to pick up, but bow and arrow." Zheng Xuanjian: "Tune means that the bow is strong and weak and the arrow is weighted ."

" Tune " may represent reconcile. "Book of Rites‧ Nei Ze": "Fanhe, sour in spring, bitter in summer, pungent in autumn, salty in winter, smooth and sweet."

" Tune " can also mean performance. The Northern Zhou Dynasty Yuxin's "Chun Fu": "The first tune of the jade pipe, the sound of the strings temporarily caress, the songs of "Yangchun" and "Lushui", the dance of the phoenix Huiluan."

" Adjustment " can also mean adjustment. Han Huankuan "On Salt and Iron-This Discussion": "Therefore, both salt and iron are lost. Therefore, it is inconvenient to pass the finances and adjust the priority."

" Tune " also refers to conditioning and conditioning. Han Lujia "Xinyu‧ Daoji": "Regulate the vitality and nourish the nature, the benevolent will live longer."

" Tune " also refers to domestication and training. Han Huankuan's "On Confucianism on Salt and Iron": "Without spurs, the Cepheid cannot adjust the horse."

" Tune " also means teasing and mocking. The second part of Tang Libai's "Poems for Yue Women": "Selling eyes and throwing hearts, folding flowers to tune travelers." Wang Qi's note: "Tune, laugh at."

The rhythm and rhythm of opera and poetry are also called " tune ". "Zhuangzi·Xu Wugui": "The husband may change the tune of one string, but the five tones are not appropriate, and the drums are all moving."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " words " and " weeks ", the original meaning is harmony and fit.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「周」聲，本義為和諧、適合。《說文》：「和也。从言，周聲。」《詩‧小雅‧車攻》：「決拾既佽，弓矢既調。」鄭玄箋：「調謂弓強弱與矢輕重相得。」

　　「調」可表示調和。《禮記‧內則》：「凡和，春多酸，夏多苦，秋多辛，冬多鹹，調以滑甘。」

　　「調」也可表示演奏。北周庾信〈春賦〉：「玉管初調，鳴絃暫撫，《陽春》、《淥水》之曲，對鳳迴鸞之舞。」

　　「調」還可表示調劑。漢桓寬《鹽鐵論‧本議》：「故鹽鐵均輸，所以通委財而調緩急，罷之不便也。」

　　「調」也指調理、調養。漢陸賈《新語‧道基》：「調氣養性，仁者壽長。」

　　「調」還指馴養、訓練。漢桓寬《鹽鐵論‧論儒》：「無鞭策，雖造父不能調駟馬。」

　　「調」也表示戲弄、嘲笑。唐李白〈越女詞〉之二：「賣眼擲春心，折花調行客。」王琦注：「調，嘲笑也。」

　　戲曲、詩歌的樂律、韻律也稱謂「調」。《莊子‧徐無鬼》：「夫或改調一弦，於五音無當也，鼓之，二十五弦皆動。」
humanum_short_description: 從「言」，「周」聲，本義為和諧、適合。

调调 		transfer, move, change, tune, mix, blend, investigate
  • circling 周 words 言 blending and mixing, changing tone all the time transferring certain ideas; circling 周 around something retrieving words 言: investigate
(Simplified: 调)
Pictophonetic: 周 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 周 [ zhōu ] Zhou dynasty; circumference
①安排處置：調令。調用。調度。調動。調任。調防。調兵遣將。
②訪查瞭解：調查。調研。
③音樂上高低長短配合和諧好聽的一組音，字音的高低升降：調子。調號。調式。腔調。曲調。大調。小調。南腔北調。
調查 [ diào chá ]: investigation; inquiry; to investigate; to survey; survey; (opinion) poll; Classifiers: 项
調動 [ diào dòng ]: to transfer; to maneuver (troops etc); movement of personnel; to mobilize; to bring into play
調研 [ diào yán ]: to investigate and research; research; investigation
調度 [ diào dù ]: to dispatch (vehicles, staff etc); to schedule; to manage; dispatcher; scheduler
①調節。［合］調排(調整安排)；調風(整頓風俗)；調氣(調節四時的氣候)；調息(調節呼吸)。
②馴服；訓練。
③調治；調養(調治保養)。［合］調鼎持衡(比喻治理國家)；調息(調養休息)；調治(醫療；療治)。
④嘲笑。［合］調喉(取笑)；調侃(用言語戲弄；嘲弄)。
⑤攙合。［合］調三窩四(搬弄是非)；調白(挑唆)；調味。
⑥經攪拌、搖晃(不同物質）混合。［合］調和鼎鼐(在鼎裏調和食物。比喻輔佐皇帝治理國家。亦喻宰相之職)；調勻；調色。
⑦調節音高或使之入調。［合］調絃；調高一個小三度或大三度。
⑧演奏。
⑨調濟。
⑩調戲。［合］調光(勾引；調情)；調引(引逗；勾引)。
⑾擲；丟。［例］我看了，搬起一塊大石，調打下去。——《西遊記》。
⑿耍。［合］調嘴調舌(耍嘴皮)；調嘴(耍嘴皮子)；調脾(耍脾氣；頑皮)。
⒀調弄，彈奏。
調整 [ tiáo zhěng ]: to adjust; adjustment; revision; Classifiers: 个
調節 [ tiáo jié ]: to adjust; to regulate; to harmonize; to reconcile (accountancy etc)
調控 [ tiáo kòng ]: to regulate; to control

調べる(しらべる): investigate

從「 言 」，「 周 」聲，本義為和諧、適合。《說文》：「和也。从言，周聲。」《詩‧小雅‧車攻》：「決拾既佽，弓矢既調。」鄭玄箋：「調謂弓強弱與矢輕重相得。」 「 調 」可表示調和。《禮記‧內則》：「凡和，春多酸，夏多苦，秋多辛，冬多鹹，調以滑甘。」 「 調 」也可表示演奏。北周庾信〈春賦〉：「玉管初調，鳴絃暫撫，《陽春》、《淥水》之曲，對鳳迴鸞之舞。」 「 調 」還可表示調劑。漢桓寬《鹽鐵論‧本議》：「故鹽鐵均輸，所以通委財而調緩急，罷之不便也。」 「 調 」也指調理、調養。漢陸賈《新語‧道基》：「調氣養性，仁者壽長。」 「 調 」還指馴養、訓練。漢桓寬《鹽鐵論‧論儒》：「無鞭策，雖造父不能調駟馬。」 「 調 」也表示戲弄、嘲笑。唐李白〈越女詞〉之二：「賣眼擲春心，折花調行客。」王琦注：「調，嘲笑也。」 戲曲、詩歌的樂律、韻律也稱謂「 調 」。《莊子‧徐無鬼》：「夫或改調一弦，於五音無當也，鼓之，二十五弦皆動。」
From the sound of " speak" and " week", the original meaning is harmony and suitability. "Shuowen": "Harmony. Congyan, Zhou Sheng." "Poetry·Xiaoya·Chegong": "Decision to pick up, but bow and arrow." Zheng Xuanjian: "Tune means that the bow is strong and weak and the arrow is weighted ." " Tune" may represent reconcile. "Book of Rites‧ Nei Ze": "Fanhe, sour in spring, bitter in summer, pungent in autumn, salty in winter, smooth and sweet." " Tune" can also mean performance. The Northern Zhou Dynasty Yuxin's "Chun Fu": "The first tune of the jade pipe, the sound of the strings temporarily caress, the songs of "Yangchun" and "Lushui", the dance of the phoenix Huiluan." " Adjustment" can also mean adjustment. Han Huankuan "On Salt and Iron-This Discussion": "Therefore, both salt and iron are lost. Therefore, it is inconvenient to pass the finances and adjust the priority." " Tune" also refers to conditioning and conditioning. Han Lujia "Xinyu‧ Daoji": "Regulate the vitality and nourish the nature, the benevolent will live longer." " Tune" also refers to domestication and training. Han Huankuan's "On Confucianism on Salt and Iron": "Without spurs, the Cepheid cannot adjust the horse." " Tune" also means teasing and mocking. The second part of Tang Libai's "Poems for Yue Women": "Selling eyes and throwing hearts, folding flowers to tune travelers." Wang Qi's note: "Tune, laugh at." The rhythm and rhythm of opera and poetry are also called " tune". "Zhuangzi·Xu Wugui": "The husband may change the tune of one string, but the five tones are not appropriate, and the drums are all moving."

調字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tiáo］
［《廣韻》徒聊切，平蕭，定。］
“稠2”的被通假字。“调1”的繁体字。
(1)协调；使协调。
(2)适合，符合。
(3)调和；调配。
(4)调停使和解。参见“調停”、“調處”。
(5)调试；调弄；演奏。
(6)调剂。
(7)调理，调养。
(8)治理。
(9)驯养，训练。
(10)驯顺。
(11)戏弄；嘲笑。
(12)挑逗；逗引。
(13)挑拨，挑唆。参见“調脣”、“調唆”。
(14)欺骗。参见“調欺”。
(15)抛掷，扔。
(16)见“調調”。
[②]［diào］
［《廣韻》徒弔切，去嘯，定。］
“调2”的繁体字。
(1)戏曲和歌曲的乐律；调子。
(2)指诗的韵律、气韵。
(3)指人的志向，志趣。
(4)才情，才调。
(5)说话、读书等的腔调。
(6)指语音上的声调。
(7)指言辞。
(8)选调；迁转；更动（工作、位置）。
(9)征调，征发。
(10)转动。
(11)调换。

調字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　調； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1166第08
【唐韻】徒遼切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】田聊切，?音迢。【說文】和也。【玉篇】和合也。【詩·小雅】弓矢旣調。【禮·月令】仲夏調竽笙竾簧。　又【韻會】揉伏也。【史記·秦本紀】大費佐舜調馴鳥獸。　又【正字通】嘲笑也。【世說】王丞相每調之。　又【廣雅】欺也，啁也，譀也，出買也。　又【莊子·齊物論】而獨不見之調調之刁刁乎。【註】樹上枝葉搖動之形。　又官名。【周禮·地官】調人掌司萬民之難而諧和之。　又姓。【廣韻】周禮有調人，其後氏焉。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?張流切，音輈。朝也。【詩·周南】未見君子，惄如調飢。【毛傳】調，朝也。又作輈。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?徒弔切，迢去聲。【玉篇】選調也。【史記·秦始皇紀】下調郡縣，轉輸菽粟芻藁。【註】下令調斂也。【前漢·食貨志】馬數萬匹，卒掌者不足，乃調旁近縣。【師古註】謂選發之也。又【張釋之傳】十年不得調。【師古註】選也。又【袁盎傳】盎以數直諫，不得久居中，調爲隴西都尉。【師古註】遷也。　又【玉篇】度也。【

Tune
Name meaning
Nothing.
tiáo, diào, zhōu
вм. 调

調

Значения

Выяснять, расследовать; приводить в порядок, устраивать; тон, тональность, интонация, акцент

Мнемоника

  • Говорить 言 кругами 周, т.е. об одном и том же, пытаясь добиться исчерпывающего ответа.

  • "Они сказали, что 言 будут приводить в порядок всё вокруг 周."

Варианты

调

Radicals: 言, 周  (say, circumference)
Meaning Mnemonic
You say something about the circumference of this area. You've looked around this whole area, making a big circle around it, because you are trying to investigate something that happened here. You also say this thing in a really quiet tone of voice, because you don't want the person or thing you're investigating to know you're on to them.
Because the radical circumference is in play, you can think of the crime scene you're investigating as a statue of a giant globe, and you're doing a circumference around it. Then, in the reading, we'll think about what you'll say.
Reading Mnemonic
"I came here to investigate this place, and I did indeed find out who the criminal is... it's none other than Mrs. Chou (ちょう)!"
From what you know about evil Mrs. Chou, you probably could have guessed it was her. The "Circumference Investigation" is now over, though you do still have to catch the perp, Mrs. Chou.
